parameter.name: BAT_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty.

parameter.name: BAT_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full.

parameter.name: BAT_V_LOAD_DROP
parameter.short_desc: Voltage drop per cell on 100% load
parameter.long_desc: This implicitely defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio and assumes linearity.

parameter.name: BAT_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of the attached battery.

parameter.name: BAT_V_SCALE_IO
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery voltage sensor on PX4IO

parameter.name: BAT_V_SCALING
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery voltage sensor on FMU v2

parameter.name: BAT_V_SCALING
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery voltage sensor on AeroCore

parameter.name: BAT_V_SCALING
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery voltage sensor on FMU v1

parameter.name: BAT_C_SCALING
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery current sensor

parameter.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_RATE_CTRL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for rate controller output
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 140253 will disable the rate controller uORB publication. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_AIRSPD_CHK
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 162128 will disable the check for an airspeed sensor. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action. --> The IO driver will not do flight termination if requested by the FMU WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_ENGINEFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for engine failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 284953 will disable the engine failure detection. If the aircraft is in engine failure mode the enine failure flag will be set to healthy WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_GPSFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for gps failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 240024 will disable the gps failure detection. If the aircraft is in gps failure mode the gps failure flag will be set to healthy WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_T
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should wait at the comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Latitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_LON
parameter.long_desc: Longitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_AH_T
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should wait at the airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_N
parameter.long_desc: After more than this number of data link timeouts the aircraft returns home directly

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CHSK
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the system will skip the comms hold wp on data link loss and will directly fly to airfield home

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Latitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LON
parameter.long_desc: Longitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: FW_ATT_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameter.name: FW_PR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the elevator input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_PR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_POS
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_NEG
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch down up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_PR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_P_ROLLFF
parameter.long_desc: This compensates during turns and ensures the nose stays level.

parameter.name: FW_RR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the aileron input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_RR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_RR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value.

parameter.name: FW_R_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum roll rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_YR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the rudder input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_YR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_YR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_Y_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum yaw rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_RR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_PR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_YR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_YCO_VMIN
parameter.long_desc: For airspeeds above this value, the yaw rate is calculated for a coordinated turn. Set to a very high value to disable.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: If the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: The TECS controller tries to fly at this airspeed.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: If the airspeed is above this value, the TECS controller will try to decrease airspeed more aggressively.

parameter.name: FW_RSP_OFF
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the roll setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the roll setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_PSP_OFF
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the pitch setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the pitch setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max roll for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max pitch for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft can over-speed on descent. This should be set to a value that can be achieved without exceeding the lower pitch angle limit and without over-speeding the aircraft.

parameter.name: FW_T_TIME_CONST
parameter.long_desc: This is the time constant of the TECS control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameter.name: FW_T_THRO_CONST
parameter.long_desc: This is the time constant of the TECS throttle control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameter.name: FW_T_THR_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

parameter.name: FW_T_INTEG_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the integrator gain on the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot.

parameter.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in metres/second square) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.

parameter.name: FW_T_HGT_OMEGA
parameter.long_desc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse vertical acceleration and barometric height to obtain an estimate of height rate and height. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the barometer, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_OMEGA
parameter.long_desc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse longitudinal acceleration and airspeed to obtain an improved airspeed estimate. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the arispeed sensor, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameter.name: FW_T_RLL2THR
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPDWEIGHT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airspeed errors, but give larger height errors. The default value of 1.0 allows the pitch control to simultaneously control height and speed. Note to Glider Pilots - set this parameter to 2.0 (The glider will adjust its pitch angle to maintain airspeed, ignoring changes in height).

parameter.name: FW_T_PTCH_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in height. The default value of 0.0 will work well provided the pitch to servo controller has been tuned properly.

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_LT
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for gps recovery before it goes into flight termination.

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_R
parameter.long_desc: Roll in degrees during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch in degrees during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_TR
parameter.long_desc: Thrust value which is set during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: GF_ON
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable geofence. Defaults to 1 because geofence is only enabled when the geofence.txt file is present.

parameter.name: GF_ALTMODE
parameter.long_desc: Select which altitude reference should be used 0 = WGS84, 1 = AMSL

parameter.name: GF_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameter.name: GF_COUNT
parameter.long_desc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered

parameter.name: FW_L1_PERIOD
parameter.long_desc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the aircraft its following. A value of 25 meters works for most aircraft. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameter.name: FW_L1_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameter.name: FW_THR_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. Most airframes have a value of 0.5-0.7.

parameter.name: FW_THR_SLEW_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum slew rate for the commanded throttle

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimum negative pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximum positive pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_R_LIM
parameter.long_desc: The maximum roll the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For overpowered aircraft, this should be reduced to a value that provides sufficient thrust to climb at the maximum pitch angle PTCH_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For electric aircraft this will normally be set to zero, but can be set to a small non-zero value if a folding prop is fitted to prevent the prop from folding and unfolding repeatedly in-flight or to provide some aerodynamic drag from a turning prop to improve the descent rate. For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set for desired idle rpm.

parameter.name: FW_THR_LND_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This throttle value will be set as throttle limit at FW_LND_TLALT, before arcraft will flare.

parameter.name: FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF
parameter.long_desc: If the altitude error exceeds this parameter, the system will climb out with maximum throttle and minimum airspeed until it is closer than this distance to the desired altitude. Mostly used for takeoff waypoints / modes. Set to zero to disable climbout mode (not recommended).

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly. If the airspeed starts to reduce, then the parameter is set to high, and if the throttle demand required to climb and maintain speed is noticeably less than FW_THR_MAX, then either FW_T_CLMB_MAX should be increased or FW_THR_MAX reduced.

parameter.name: FW_LND_FLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing flare altitude (relative to landing altitude)

parameter.name: FW_LND_TLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing throttle limit altitude (relative landing altitude)
parameter.long_desc: Default of -1.0f lets the system default to applying throttle limiting at 2/3 of the flare altitude.

parameter.name: FW_LND_USETER
parameter.short_desc: Enable or disable usage of terrain estimate during landing
parameter.long_desc: 0: disabled, 1: enabled

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_A
parameter.long_desc: LAUN_CAT_A * LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_T
parameter.long_desc: LAUN_CAT_A * LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_MDEL
parameter.long_desc: Delay between starting attitude control and powering up the throttle (giving throttle control to the controller) Before this timespan is up the throttle will be set to LAUN_THR_PRE, set to 0 to deactivate

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_PMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum pitch before the throttle is powered up (during motor delay phase)
parameter.long_desc: This is an extra limit for the maximum pitch which is imposed in the phase before the throttle turns on. This allows to limit the maximum pitch angle during a bungee launch (make the launch less steep).

parameter.name: LAUN_THR_PRE
parameter.long_desc: The throttle is set to this value while the system is waiting for the take-off.

parameter.name: MAV_USEHILGPS
parameter.short_desc: Use/Accept HIL GPS message (even if not in HIL mode) If set to 1 incomming HIL GPS messages are parsed

parameter.name: MAV_FWDEXTSP
parameter.short_desc: Forward external setpoint messages If set to 1 incomming external setpoint messages will be directly forwarded to the controllers if in offboard control mode

parameter.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Even if first waypoint has altitude less then MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT above home position, system will climb to MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT on takeoff, then go to waypoint.

parameter.name: MIS_ONBOARD_EN
parameter.long_desc: When enabled, missions that have been uploaded by the GCS are stored and reloaded after reboot persistently.

parameter.name: MIS_DIST_1WP
parameter.short_desc: Maximal horizontal distance from home to first waypoint
parameter.long_desc: Failsafe check to prevent running mission stored from previous flight at a new takeoff location. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if the current waypoint is more distant than MIS_DIS_1WP from the current position.

parameter.name: MIS_ALTMODE
parameter.long_desc: 0: the system will follow a zero order hold altitude setpoint 1: the system will follow a first order hold altitude setpoint values follow the definition in enum mission_altitude_mode

parameter.name: NAV_LOITER_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default value of loiter radius for missions, loiter, RTL, etc. (fixedwing only).

parameter.name: NAV_ACC_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default acceptance radius, overridden by acceptance radius of waypoint if set.

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_OBC
parameter.short_desc: Set OBC mode for data link loss
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the behaviour on data link loss is set to a mode according to the OBC rules

parameter.name: NAV_RCL_OBC
parameter.short_desc: Set OBC mode for rc loss
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the behaviour on data link loss is set to a mode according to the OBC rules

parameter.name: MC_ROLL_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_PITCH_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_YAW_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_YAW_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for manual yaw control. 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for yaw rate, has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit max allowed thrust.

parameter.name: MPC_Z_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical position error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPC_Z_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for altitude control in stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL). 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non-zero value allows to resist wind.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for position stabilized mode (POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPC_XY_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for position control in position control mode (POSCTRL). 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_AIR
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_LND
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.

parameter.name: BD_GPROPERTIES
parameter.long_desc: This parameter encodes the ground drag coefficient and the corresponding decrease in wind speed from the plane altitude to ground altitude.

parameter.name: BD_TURNRADIUS
parameter.long_desc: The planes known minimal turn radius - use a higher value to make the plane maneuver more distant from the actual drop position. This is to ensure the wings are level during the drop.

parameter.name: BD_PRECISION
parameter.long_desc: If the system is closer than this distance on passing over the drop position, it will release the payload. This is a safeguard to prevent a drop out of the required accuracy.

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_CD
parameter.short_desc: Payload drag coefficient of the dropped object
parameter.long_desc: The drag coefficient (cd) is the typical drag constant for air. It is in general object specific, but the closest primitive shape to the actual object should give good results: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_coefficient

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_MASS
parameter.long_desc: A typical small toy ball: 0.025 kg OBC water bottle: 0.6 kg

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_SURFACE
parameter.long_desc: A typical small toy ball: (0.045 * 0.045) / 4.0 * pi = 0.001590 m^2 OBC water bottle: (0.063 * 0.063) / 4.0 * pi = 0.003117 m^2

parameter.name: PE_VEL_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the velocity estimate from GPS.

parameter.name: PE_POS_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the position estimate from GPS.

parameter.name: PE_HGT_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the height estimate from the barometer.

parameter.name: PE_MAG_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the magnetic field estimate from the magnetometer.

parameter.name: PE_TAS_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the airspeed estimate.

parameter.name: PE_GPS_ALT_WGT
parameter.short_desc: GPS vs. barometric altitude update weight
parameter.long_desc: RE-CHECK this.

parameter.name: PE_EAS_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this value will make the filter trust this sensor less and trust other sensors more.

parameter.name: PE_VELNE_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Velocity measurement noise in north-east (horizontal) direction
parameter.long_desc: Generic default: 0.3, multicopters: 0.5, ground vehicles: 0.5

parameter.name: PE_VELD_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic default: 0.5, multicopters: 0.7, ground vehicles: 0.7

parameter.name: PE_POSNE_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.5, multicopters: 0.5, ground vehicles: 0.5

parameter.name: PE_POSD_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.5, multicopters: 1.0, ground vehicles: 1.0

parameter.name: PE_MAG_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.05, multicopters: 0.05, ground vehicles: 0.05

parameter.name: PE_GYRO_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.015, multicopters: 0.015, ground vehicles: 0.015. This noise controls how much the filter trusts the gyro measurements. Increasing it makes the filter trust the gyro less and other sensors more.

parameter.name: PE_ACC_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.25, multicopters: 0.25, ground vehicles: 0.25. Increasing this value makes the filter trust the accelerometer less and other sensors more.

parameter.name: PE_GBIAS_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 1e-07f, multicopters: 1e-07f, ground vehicles: 1e-07f. Increasing this value will make the gyro bias converge faster but noisier.

parameter.name: PE_ABIAS_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.0001f, multicopters: 0.0001f, ground vehicles: 0.0001f. Increasing this value makes the bias estimation faster and noisier.

parameter.name: PE_MAGE_PNOISE
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer earth frame offsets process noise
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.0001, multicopters: 0.0001, ground vehicles: 0.0001. Increasing this value makes the magnetometer earth bias estimate converge faster but also noisier.

parameter.name: PE_MAGB_PNOISE
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer body frame offsets process noise
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.0003, multicopters: 0.0003, ground vehicles: 0.0003. Increasing this value makes the magnetometer body bias estimate converge faster but also noisier.

parameter.name: PE_POSDEV_INIT
parameter.long_desc: If the standard deviation of the GPS position estimate is below this threshold in meters, the filter will initialize.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_BARO
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for barometer altitude measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_GPS_P
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for GPS altitude measurements. GPS altitude data is very noisy and should be used only as slow correction for baro offset.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_VIS_P
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for vision altitude measurements. vision altitude data is very noisy and should be used only as slow correction for baro offset.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_SONAR
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for sonar measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_GPS_P
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for GPS position
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for GPS position measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_GPS_V
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for GPS velocity
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for GPS velocity measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_VIS_P
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for vision position
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for vision position measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_VIS_V
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for vision velocity
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for vision velocity measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_FLOW
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for optical flow
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for optical flow (velocity) measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_RES_V
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for resetting velocity
parameter.long_desc: When velocity sources lost slowly decrease estimated horizontal velocity with this weight.

parameter.name: INAV_W_GPS_FLOW
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight factor for GPS when optical flow available
parameter.long_desc: When optical flow data available, multiply GPS weights (for position and velocity) by this factor.

parameter.name: INAV_W_ACC_BIAS
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for accelerometer bias estimation. 0 to disable.

parameter.name: INAV_FLOW_K
parameter.long_desc: Factor to convert raw optical flow (in pixels) to radians [rad/px].

parameter.name: INAV_FLOW_Q_MIN
parameter.long_desc: 0 - lowest quality, 1 - best quality.

parameter.name: INAV_SONAR_FILT
parameter.long_desc: Sonar filter detects spikes on sonar measurements and used to detect new surface level.

parameter.name: INAV_SONAR_ERR
parameter.short_desc: Sonar maximal error for new surface
parameter.long_desc: If sonar measurement error is larger than this value it skiped (spike) or accepted as new surface level (if offset is stable).

parameter.name: INAV_LAND_T
parameter.long_desc: Vehicle assumed landed if no altitude changes happened during this time on low throttle.

parameter.name: INAV_LAND_DISP
parameter.long_desc: Dispersion threshold for triggering land detector.

parameter.name: INAV_LAND_THR
parameter.long_desc: Value should be lower than minimal hovering thrust. Half of it is good choice.

parameter.name: INAV_DELAY_GPS
parameter.long_desc: GPS delay compensation

parameter.name: CBRK_NO_VISION
parameter.long_desc: Set to the appropriate key (328754) to disable vision input.

parameter.name: NAV_RCL_LT
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should loiter at current position before termination Set to -1 to make the system skip loitering

parameter.name: RTL_LOITER_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default value of loiter radius after RTL (fixedwing only).

parameter.name: RTL_RETURN_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude to fly back in RTL in meters

parameter.name: RTL_DESCEND_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Stay at this altitude above home position after RTL descending. Land (i.e. slowly descend) from this altitude if autolanding allowed.

parameter.name: RTL_LAND_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: Delay after descend before landing in RTL mode. If set to -1 the system will not land but loiter at NAV_LAND_ALT.

parameter.name: RC1_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for RC channel 1

parameter.name: RC1_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value (same as min for throttle)

parameter.name: RC1_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for RC channel 1

parameter.name: RC1_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC1_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC2_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for RC channel 2

parameter.name: RC2_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value (same as min for throttle)

parameter.name: RC2_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for RC channel 2

parameter.name: RC2_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC2_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC_DSM_BIND
parameter.long_desc: -1 = Idle, 0 = Start DSM2 bind, 1 = Start DSMX bind

parameter.name: RC_MAP_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading roll inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading pitch inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_THROTTLE
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading throttle inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_YAW
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading yaw inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_MODE_SW
parameter.long_desc: This is the main flight mode selector. The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for deciding about the main mode. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX1
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera pitch

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX2
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera roll

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX3
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera azimuth / yaw

parameter.name: SDLOG_RATE
parameter.long_desc: A value of -1 indicates the commandline argument should be obeyed. A value of 0 sets the minimum rate, any other value is interpreted as rate in Hertz. This parameter is only read out before logging starts (which commonly is before arming).

parameter.name: SDLOG_EXT
parameter.long_desc: A value of -1 indicates the commandline argument should be obeyed. A value of 0 disables extended logging mode, a value of 1 enables it. This parameter is only read out before logging starts (which commonly is before arming).

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_OFF
parameter.long_desc: The offset (zero-reading) in Pascal

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_ANSC
parameter.long_desc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform. Possible values are: 0 = No rotation 1 = Yaw 45° 2 = Yaw 90° 3 = Yaw 135° 4 = Yaw 180° 5 = Yaw 225° 6 = Yaw 270° 7 = Yaw 315° 8 = Roll 180° 9 = Roll 180°, Yaw 45° 10 = Roll 180°, Yaw 90° 11 = Roll 180°, Yaw 135° 12 = Pitch 180° 13 = Roll 180°, Yaw 225° 14 = Roll 180°, Yaw 270° 15 = Roll 180°, Yaw 315° 16 = Roll 90° 17 = Roll 90°, Yaw 45° 18 = Roll 90°, Yaw 90° 19 = Roll 90°, Yaw 135° 20 = Roll 270° 21 = Roll 270°, Yaw 45° 22 = Roll 270°, Yaw 90° 23 = Roll 270°, Yaw 135° 24 = Pitch 90° 25 = Pitch 270°

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_X_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_EXT_MAG_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the external magnetometer relative to the platform (not relative to the FMU). See SENS_BOARD_ROT for possible values.

parameter.name: SENS_EXT_MAG
parameter.long_desc: * Set to 0 (default) to auto-detect (will try to get the external as primary) * Set to 1 to force the external magnetometer as primary * Set to 2 to force the internal magnetometer as primary

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameter.long_desc: Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to set platform-specific parameters to their default values on next system startup.

parameter.name: SYS_USE_IO
parameter.long_desc: Can be used to use a standard startup script but with a FMU only set-up. Set to 0 to force the FMU only set-up.

parameter.name: SYS_RESTART_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Set by px4io to indicate type of restart

parameter.name: UAVCAN_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: Enables support for UAVCAN-interfaced actuators and sensors.

parameter.name: UAVCAN_NODE_ID
parameter.long_desc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.

parameter.name: ATT_J11
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia matrix diagonal entry (1, 1)

parameter.name: ATT_J22
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia matrix diagonal entry (2, 2)

parameter.name: ATT_J33
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia matrix diagonal entry (3, 3)

parameter.name: ATT_J_EN
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia enabled in estimator
parameter.long_desc: If set to != 0 the moment of inertia will be used in the estimator

parameter.name: COM_DL_LOSS_EN
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable actions triggered when the datalink is lost.

parameter.name: COM_DL_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_DL_REG_T
parameter.short_desc: After a data link loss: after this this amount of seconds with a healthy datalink the 'datalink loss' flag is set back to false

parameter.name: COM_EF_THROT
parameter.short_desc: Engine failure triggers only above this throttle value

parameter.name: COM_EF_C2T
parameter.short_desc: Engine failure triggers only below this current/throttle value

parameter.name: COM_EF_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Engine failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time

parameter.name: COM_RC_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: After this amount of seconds without RC connection the rc lost flag is set to true

parameter.name: MT_ENABLED
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable mTECS

parameter.name: MT_THR_FF
parameter.short_desc: Total Energy Rate Control Feedforward Maps the total energy rate setpoint to the throttle setpoint

parameter.name: MT_THR_P
parameter.short_desc: Total Energy Rate Control P Maps the total energy rate error to the throttle setpoint

parameter.name: MT_THR_I
parameter.short_desc: Total Energy Rate Control I Maps the integrated total energy rate to the throttle setpoint

parameter.name: MT_THR_OFF
parameter.short_desc: Total Energy Rate Control Offset (Cruise throttle sp)

parameter.name: MT_PIT_FF
parameter.short_desc: Energy Distribution Rate Control Feedforward Maps the energy distribution rate setpoint to the pitch setpoint

parameter.name: MT_PIT_P
parameter.short_desc: Energy Distribution Rate Control P Maps the energy distribution rate error to the pitch setpoint

parameter.name: MT_PIT_I
parameter.short_desc: Energy Distribution Rate Control I Maps the integrated energy distribution rate error to the pitch setpoint

parameter.name: MT_PIT_OFF
parameter.short_desc: Total Energy Distribution Offset (Cruise pitch sp)

parameter.name: MT_FPA_LP
parameter.short_desc: Lowpass (cutoff freq.) for the flight path angle

parameter.name: MT_FPA_P
parameter.short_desc: P gain for the altitude control Maps the altitude error to the flight path angle setpoint

parameter.name: MT_FPA_D
parameter.short_desc: D gain for the altitude control Maps the change of altitude error to the flight path angle setpoint

parameter.name: MT_FPA_D_LP
parameter.short_desc: Lowpass for FPA error derivative calculation (see MT_FPA_D)

parameter.name: MT_ACC_P
parameter.short_desc: P gain for the airspeed control Maps the airspeed error to the acceleration setpoint

parameter.name: MT_ACC_D
parameter.short_desc: D gain for the airspeed control Maps the change of airspeed error to the acceleration setpoint

parameter.name: MT_ACC_D_LP
parameter.short_desc: Lowpass for ACC error derivative calculation (see MT_ACC_D)

parameter.name: MT_LND_THR_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimal throttle in landing mode (only last phase of landing)

parameter.name: MT_LND_THR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximal throttle in landing mode (only last phase of landing)

parameter.name: MT_THR_I_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Integrator Limit for Total Energy Rate Control

parameter.name: MT_PIT_I_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Integrator Limit for Energy Distribution Rate Control

parameter.name: FW_FLARE_PMIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_TLALT is reached

parameter.name: FW_FLARE_PMAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_TLALT is reached

parameter.name: RC_MAP_FAILSAFE
parameter.long_desc: The RC mapping index indicates which channel is used for failsafe If 0, whichever channel is mapped to throttle is used otherwise the value indicates the specific rc channel to use

parameter.name: RC_ASSIST_TH
parameter.long_desc: min:-1 max:+1 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_AUTO_TH
parameter.long_desc: min:-1 max:+1 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_POSCTL_TH
parameter.long_desc: min:-1 max:+1 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_RETURN_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for selecting return to launch mode
parameter.long_desc: min:-1 max:+1 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_LOITER_TH
parameter.long_desc: min:-1 max:+1 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_ACRO_TH
parameter.long_desc: min:-1 max:+1 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_OFFB_TH
parameter.long_desc: min:-1 max:+1 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th
